page.title: 12BRADFIELD BUSHNELLS GREEN
page.content: Bushnells Green bordering Bradfield is rough grazing land with pheasant shoots.There are two farms, one a small farm and the other an established farm on which there are some historical buildings including a granary on nine staddle stones and a threshing barn. The new buildings are asbestos and include an animal food store and an animal building for cattle kept in deep litter.The small farm has 150 beef cattle, 100 milking cows and 150 sheep. They grow grass for hay and maize for animal feed. There is a small amount of housing in the area. Council houses are being bought by the tenants who are farm workers. There are four nineteenth century houses where the people commute to London. The woodland is in small copses for pheasant rearing.
